treatment.reference: Methanohalophilus mahii gen. nov. sp. nov. a Methylotrophic Halophilic Methanogent IJSB 38:122-123
treatment.description: Morphology and colony characteristics are the same as those described above for the genus. Sodium chloride optimum, 2.0 M. Temperature optimum 35˚C, no growth at temperatures above 45°C. pH optimum, approximately 7.5. Source, anaerobic sediment from Great Salt Lake, Utah. Physiology, fastidious anaerobe. Trimethylamine, dimethylamine, methylamine, and methanol serve as substrates for growth and methanogenesis; hydrogen-carbon dioxide, formate, and acetate do not serve as substrates for growth and methanogenesis. The G+C content of the deoxyribonucleic acid is 48.5 mol%, as determined by buoyant density. The type strain is strain SLP (Salt Lake Paterek). This strain has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as strain ATCC 35705.
